definition: car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: If the car does not yield to pedestrian, the car could be ticketed.
sentences.chinese: 大多數國家，如果車子不給行人讓路，會被抄罰單的。

sentences.english: And 40 percent said they would be more likely to address issues with their car than their health.
sentences.chinese: 的人說相比較自己的健康他們更喜歡處理車子問題。

sentences.english: A gaggle of schoolgirls followed the tennis star to his car.
sentences.chinese: 一羣嘰哩呱啦的女學生跟著網球明星到他的車子。

sentences.english: That mixture is enough to move his jeep; however, whenever the car moves, it exhales food smell.
sentences.chinese: 當車子開動時，總是會散發出食物的味道。

sentences.english: When we were an agrarian nation, all cars were trucks.
sentences.chinese: 在我們是農業國家的時候，所有的車子都是卡車。

sentences.english: The passenger side of my car has dents and scratches all over it.
sentences.chinese: 車子的右側到處是凹痕和刮痕。

sentences.english: Buckle up, it may harder for aliens to suck you out of your car.
sentences.chinese: 繫好安全帶，這樣外形人也更難把你從車子裏抓走。

sentences.english: While crossing the street, he looked right and left, afraid that he might run into some passing car.
sentences.chinese: 他穿過馬路時，左顧右盼，害怕撞到過路的車子上。

sentences.english: Thursday, the car was sent for a two-week repair.
sentences.chinese: 週四，車子送修需時兩週。

sentences.english: I do have 3 bikes with handle bar brakes that she can use.
sentences.chinese: 我有三輛車子是帶手閘的，下次她可以用這種車子。

sentences.english: I do have 3 bikes with handle bar brakes that she can use.
sentences.chinese: 我有三輛車子是帶手閘的，下次她可以用這種車子。

sentences.english: The car really opened up when being on the expressway.
sentences.chinese: 一上高速路，車子就真正加快速度了。

sentences.english: His car got bogged down and wouldn't move.
sentences.chinese: 他的車子陷入泥沼開不動了。

sentences.english: My car brakes went out on me when I was driving.
sentences.chinese: 我的車子在我開的時候煞車失靈了。

sentences.english: As the car drove up to the door, he flew out to meet his son.
sentences.chinese: 當車子開到門口時，他飛也似地衝出去接他兒子。

definition: to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
